Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery skyphos; interior glazed black; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of part of handle floral (lotus and tendril with added red for kalyx and outer petal of lotus remaining); below, narrow dilute band above band or zone in added red.
Curator's comments: For parallels regarding the lotus flower, see the neck-amphora (P13113) in Agora XXIII, 119, no. 139, pl. 17, no. 139, attributed to the Gorgon Painter.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 369-370, no. B498)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0339) (Phase 1)
